data.title: One of our favorite sushi places
data.text: Great selection and excellent food! A nice selection of sakes and cocktails as well. Cozy feel and attentive service as well.

data.title: 13 years later...love my husband, love Little Tree.
data.text:
This place was one of the first places my husband took me when dating. I was here from California visiting my family and I was skeptical about a Michigan sushi place.  (Grew up here and sushi was not a thing one did.)  So I knew I'd be comparing to all my favorite LA spots.  It's stood the test of time.
Our 11 year old has grown up with his favorite rolls and the Miso Soup with it's "floating marshmellows" (that's what he's called tofu.)
My older son and 17 year old daughter frequent a lot with their friends.
One can't go wrong with the sashimi or specialty rolls - katana, harley, dragon, and godzilla.  We love them all.  I've found all the fish to be fresh and clean in taste.
The tempura items are also great for those not wanting anything raw.
Overall, the service is usually proficient and satisfactory.  We've had the occasional ambivalent server but never any bad service.
It's our sushi place.

data.title: Good sushi, service is so so
data.text: I have visited several times, all for lunch. Sushi has been consistently good. Other dishes are okay, but i would stick with sushi. Service hasn't been consistent. My most recent visit last week i asked my waiter for a regular silverware instead of those chop sticks. After waiting for five minutes i got up to go looking for him and encountered the owner. Asked the owner for a regular fork & knife and got it, but when my waiter appeared, he said with sarcasm " In a big hurry, got to have it right away" Owner then disappeared and stayed hidden. I haven't visited since, i have been going to Sushi Bon in Warren where i never had any problems.

data.title: Fantastic Sushi
data.text: Went to Little Tree by suggestion of a friend. The meal and service was very good, one of the best Sushi dishes I've had. My friends enjoyed their meals just as much as I did.

data.title: One of the Best Sushi Places Around
data.text:
It was 5 years ago at Little Tree Sushi Bar that I first tried sushi. I was skeptical and super doubtful to eat it because I had all the "sushi perceptions" that non-sushi eaters tend to have. "I don't eat raw fish and fish eggs."

They proved me wrong. This place is one of the best sushi places I've been to and since the first time I've been a bit of a sushi addict. The service was good. The food was fresh and whenever I'm in the Royal Oak area, it usually a must that we stop here.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Had a great dinner at Little Tree with a friend tonight.  I had the Filipino Ginataang, he had the gang gai with tofu, with both had tom yum gai soup.  All nicely seasoned, good selection of beer, wine, sakes, and cocktails.  Finished with hot green tea and the hot banana wraps with ice cream.  All good, and our server, Elizabeth, was great.

data.title: Enjoyed a great meal
data.text:
Met my son for dinner.  After a frustrating seating experience because parking took him so long and they only seat full parties.  Not a bad policy if executed correctly.  However, while my wife and I waited for my son and his gf to park, hostess sat last 2, 4 person booths with 2 tops.  After waiting an additional 10 mins for someone to get up I inquired with the manager why we couldn't sit down but they quickly sat 2 tops while we waited.  We were 2 as well until our other 2 showed up????
No explanation was given.  Had they sat 4 tops while we waited I would have totally understood. 
That being that, food was great, appizers, entrees, all of it.  Spicy tune roll...yum!
Service was good but inconsistent as the restaurant was slowing down. Noone was drinking at our table, unattentiveness is often a result.  Never saw manager again either.

data.title: I like this place for the sunomono with King crab and the Tom Yum soup, but the sushi is average.
data.text: I like how thin the cucumber is cut, the vinegar is perfectly sweet, the ginger salad was okay, but the ginger sauce at Noble Fish is much better, as well as the sushi.  My BF had the chicken satay but all but 1 piece was undercooked, which is the 3rd time we have come and he's gotten a chicken dish that was undercooked.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Love this place.  Always has fresh, tasty sushi.  Also highly recommend their Thai fried rice (medium heat).

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: We have had dinner there and take out and it has been excellent every time. We usually stick with the sushi but they have full entrees and meal as well.

data.title: Average everything except service
data.text: The sushi was average, not great, not terrible. The samarui the best of all the rolls we had. The decor is nicely set up, but there are 3 televisions all showing sports, which takes away from the ambience. The prices aren't bad either. But the service was excellent. The service is what brought this from 3 to 4 stars.

data.title: I don't eat sushi but the non-sushi food is good
data.text: My wife and I stopped in for a quick, early dinner and were seated right away.  My wife has a soy allergy and the staff was very accommodating with checking ingredients in everything for possible allergens.  My wife had the Veggie Delight: Spinach, cream cheese, cucumber, avocado, steamed asparagus and garlic mayo rolled in nori instead of the sesame soy paper and with the sweet gourd left out.  I had the Mee Thai: Thin egg noodles with onions, bell peppers, carrots, mushroom, bamboo shoots, baby corn and broccoli in a sweet brown Thai sauce, with no meat and medium spice.  We shared the veggie spring rolls.  My wife didn't enjoy her roll as much as the last time we ate here, possibly one of the veggies didn't agree with her or some soy product  cross-contamination occurred; she really enjoyed the spring rolls though.  My Mee Thai was really good with just the right amount of spice.  Service was a little spotty given that it was almost empty at the time but all-in-all, good food for a decent price, especially considering that I had enough left over for lunch the next day.

data.title: Never going back
data.text: Food was not good. Service was poor. Waited over 1.5 hours for a table just to get food that was blend and flavorless. The chicken was over cooked and they refused to make if better. I will never return to this restaurant.

data.title: yummy
data.text: love the sushi here, and their Thai food is amazing. excellent service for every time I've gone here.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: I'm really picky when it comes to sushi, and this place so far hasn't disappointed me. Minus the Spider Roll. Just wasn't my cup of tea. The place is very clean and the wait usually isn't too bad. However on a weekend, you might have to wait a bit.   I only wish their wine pours were a lil bit more!  : )

data.title: A Little Different but missed the mark.
data.text:
There are plenty of restaurants to choose from in Downtown Royal Oak.  The area was very busy for a Wednesday night.  The decor was tired.  There was an unpleasing odor around the back entrance area.  There was only one Asian-looking person behind the sushi bar, most of the staff was American.
There were some interesting dishes on the menu. We tried a few unique items and they totally missed the mark.  Some we didn't even finish.  The Potstickers we had as an appetizer were very tasty but that was it.  The sushi was very plain.  I don't think they were using the best quality ingredients, but it was not cheap.  We spent $40 per person (with 2 drinks each).  I've had way better for less money.

data.title: Great "Fusion" restaurant
data.text: Little Tree is known for fresh sushi and great Saki, but they also have the most delicious Pad Thai I have ever tried!  It's very light and luscious!  A great meal to share with someone if you need a pick me up after a movie at Landmark Main or Emagine, right across the street!  Also, the ginger salad is fabulous and refreshing!

data.title: Excellent sushi, fairly swanky with 4 Asain cuisines.
data.text: Small bar area was well attended by wait staff where we sat at the window to enjoy cocktails and dinner. On a Saturday night, we walked in without reservations and found a table without issue. I was pleased with the martini menu and had two refreshing Pearl-tinis during our meal. The two receptionists we're not the ideal for this type restaurant; hubby and I both commented on their unprofessional behavior. Other than this, we had little to complain about. The selection of sushi and variety of other Asian dishes is incredible. We enjoyed seaweed salad, shrimp and crab puffs and 5 sushi rolls (6 pieces each). We've been to this restaurant before, over a year ago, and I thought that the dining room could use a good cleaning and a refreshing of the decor. And we've seen this restaurant much busier on a Saturday night, so much so that you would have to wait for a table. Maybe clientele has dropped off a bit, or the newer restaurants in the immediate area are more attractive to the Royal Oak "crowd".

data.title: soooooooooooo bad
data.text: worst sushi ever!!! warm soggy sushi rice, had rolls dipped in tempura and there was still raw batter omg sooooooooooooo bad threw it out.  Will stick with cafe sushi best sushi and rice ever...cold...frim and fresh!!  Never going back here

data.title: Great sushi and value
data.text: My husband and I love this place!  We think that there sushi is always phenomenal.  Their Asian food is great as well.  The drinks and saki are delicious.  You really get a great value for your money!  Don't forget to ask for extra spicy sauce on the side.
